weather_report:
Evanston is currently experiencing a brisk evening with temperatures settling in the mid-20s, complemented by a refreshing feeling in the air, perfect for those who enjoy a chilly ambiance. The scene is mostly clear, offering a glimpse of the vast night sky against the backdrop of Lake Michigan, although the calmness of the evening will soon give way to more tumultuous weather. 

Tonight, residents can expect scattered snow showers before dawn, as clouds gather overhead. With a low dipping into the low teens, the wind will pick up significantly—howling at 25 to 30 miles per hour from the west-northwest, bringing wind chill values that could feel as frigid as -5 degrees. As for wave conditions on the lake, anticipate some agitation due to these winds, possibly creating rougher waters. A light dusting of snow is expected, but accumulations will be minimal. Those venturing out should bundle up with warm layers, including hats and gloves, to fend off the brisk chill. Given that it's early December, this weather aligns with the typical chill of the season, though the impending wind may intensify the experience for outdoor enthusiasts. Ideal activities might include a cozy night in or perhaps a brisk walk along the shoreline, while keeping an eye on the evolving weather.
